short_description: Measures whether salaries and benefits are competitive with private-sector equivalents and sustainable relative to cost of living
components: Salary competitiveness vs. private sector, Cost-of-living adjusted purchasing power, Benefits comprehensiveness (pension/health/leave)
why_it_matters: Competitive compensation attracts talent, reduces turnover, and ensures public servants can afford to serve their communities long-term

short_description: Evaluates whether employees stay with the state and whether critical positions are adequately filled
components: Retention rate and turnover, Vacancy rates in critical sectors (education/healthcare/social services/corrections), Average employee tenure
why_it_matters: A healthy workforce means experienced employees, institutional knowledge, consistent service delivery, and reduced recruitment/training costs

short_description: Assesses how much citizens trust state government and how visibly public servants are recognized and celebrated
components: Trust in state government operations, Frequency and visibility of public recognition events
why_it_matters: Public trust enables effective governance, while visible recognition validates public servants' contributions and inspires future generations to serve

short_description: Measures resources devoted to employee training
column7: Training budget per employee, Professional development program access, Technology modernization investment
column8: Investing in people improves service quality, employee satisfaction, and organizational capacity to meet evolving citizen needs

short_description: Evaluates formal systems and programs that celebrate public service and outstanding employee performance
components: Story documentation and sharing (HOPS), Formal recognition programs and awards, Official observances (Public Service Recognition Week)
why_it_matters: Systematic recognition reinforces a culture of appreciation, motivates excellence, and publicly demonstrates the value of public service
